intro: Epilobium lineare var. oliganthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willowherb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, often calcareous soils, such as along stream banks or in wet meadows. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy inflorescences. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
